quotes: She was born on 16 September 1927
who became in 1943 the Japanese ambassador to Finland
she lived in the U.S. (she attended the Catlin Gabel School in Portland) from 4 to 8 years old
also lived in China from 8 to 10 during the Japanese occupation
She was awarded a PhD in Political Science from the University of California, Berkeley in 1963
in 1960 she married Shijuro Ogata
In 1965, she became Lecturer at International Christian University
After 1980, she taught international politics at Sophia University
until her departure to join the UNHCR in 1991
Ogata at the World Economic Forum on Africa, Cape Town, South Africa, on 4 June 2008
